Pre-Game Insights: The Houston Astros play the Kansas City Royals with a 1-0 series lead.
The Astros have gone 35-13 in games when they did not give up a home run.
Royals pitchers have a collective 3.91 ERA, which ranks seventh in the AL.
The Royals are up 3-1 in the season series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Yordan Alvarez leads the Astros with a.313 batting average, and has 29 doubles, two triples, 28 home runs, 60 walks and 71 RBI.
Bobby Witt Jr. leads the Royals with 78 extra base hits (39 doubles, 11 triples and 28 home runs).
Salvador Perez is 11-for-38 with four doubles, three home runs and nine RBI over the past 10 games.
Yainer Diaz is 12-for-42 with three home runs and three RBI over the last 10 games.
Others: The Astros are facing Seth Lugo (14-8, 3.19 ERA, 1.12 WHIP, 146 strikeouts) from the Royals, while the Royals are facing Framber Valdez (13-6, 3.27 ERA, 1.14 WHIP, 139 strikeouts) from the Astros.
The line for the game is Astros -160, Royals +134; over/under is 8 runs.
